article:
In chemistry, a 'catalyst support' is the material, usually a solid with a
high surface area, to which a catalyst is
affixed. http://goldbook.iupac.org/S06147.html The reactivity of
heterogeneous catalysts and nanomaterial-based catalysts occurs at the
surface atoms. Consequently great effort is made to maximize the surface area
of a catalyst by distributing it over the support. The support may be inert
or participate in the catalytic reactions. Typical supports include various
kinds of carbon, alumina, and silica. Zhen Ma, Francisco Zaera
"Heterogeneous Catalysis by Metals" in Encyclopedia of Inorganic Chemistry,
2006, John Wiley.
